VERMONT AGENCY OF TRANSPORTATION WAS AWARDED A DISCRETIONARY AWARD AS PART OF THE HUMAN SERVICES COORDINATION RESEARCH DISCRETIONARY PROGRAM AND IS THUS REQUESTING $170000 IN FY16 5312 FUNDS IN ORDER TO ESTABLISH AN EASILY REPLICABLE MODEL IN VERMONT TO INCREASE ACCESS AND COORDINATION TO LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS IN RECOVERY FROM SUBSTANCE ABUSE SPECIFICALLY OPIOID ADDICTION AS OUTLINED IN THE ORIGINAL DISCRETIONARY APPLICATION. THE GOVERNOR OF VERMONT HAS ESTABLISHED AN OPIOID COORDINATION COUNCIL (OCC) TO DISCUSS IMPROVED SERVICES FOR INDIVIDUALS STRUGGLING WITH ADDICTION. ONE OF THE MAJOR FACTORS IDENTIFIED WAS TRANSPORTATION NEEDS. THE GRANT FUNDS WILL PROVIDE VITAL RESEARCH TO IDENTIFY AND PILOT INNOVATIVE STRATEGIES TO EXPAND EXISTING RURAL TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO ADDRESS GAPS IN TRANSPORTATION ACCESS TO SUPPORTIVE ADJUNCT SERVICES TO SUPPORT RECOVERY FROM ADDICTION UTILIZING ITS EXISTING DEMAND RESPONSE TRANSIT SERVICE DEEMED AS RECOVERY RIDES - ACCESS TO SUBSTANCE TREATMENT AND EMPLOYMENT. EACH WILL PROVIDE $10000 IN VOLUNTEER DRIVER HOURS TO SUPPORT THE PROJECT AND BOTH ORGANIZATIONS ARE COMMITTED TO PARTICIPATING IN DATA COLLECTION REQUIREMENTS TO ENSURE THE FUNDS ARE USED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE GRANT. DOCUMENTATION FROM EACH ORGANIZATION IS ATTACHED.

THE VIRGINIA MICROTRANSIT DEPLOYMENT INITIATIVE WILL SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THE FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION (FTA) AND THE US DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATIONS MOBILITY INNOVATION INITIATIVE BY INCORPORATING MICROTRANSIT TECHNOLOGY INTO RURAL TRANSIT OPERATIONS. THE PROJECT WILL EXPLORE HOW MICROTRANSIT TECHNOLOGY AND CONCEPTS CAN BE USED TO IMPROVE SERVICE EFFICIENCY AND RIDER EXPERIENCES IN RURAL AREAS THROUGHOUT VIRGINIA. THIS APPLICATION UTILIZES THE INTEGRATED MOBILITY INNOVATION (IMI) FEDERAL AWARD OF $160930 ALONG WITH A STATE MATCH OF $68970 FOR A TOTAL OF $229900. THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE IS FROM MAY 1 2020 THROUGH SEPTEMBER 30 2022 (DEMONSTRATION TO CONCLUDE JUNE 30 2022 PLUS THREE MONTHS OF FLOAT). FTA AND THE USDOTS MOBILITY INNOVATION PROGRAM PROVIDES FEDERAL RESEARCH FUNDS TO PROJECT TEAMS TO DEMONSTRATE INNOVATIVE EFFECTIVE APPROACHES PRACTICES AND TECHNOLOGIES THAT ENHANCE EFFECTIVENESS INCREASE EFFICIENCY EXPAND QUALITY PROMOTE SAFETY AND ULTIMATELY IMPROVE THE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION RIDERS EXPERIENCE. THE GOAL OF THE VIRGINIA MICROTRANSIT DEPLOYMENT INITIATIVE IS TO PROVIDE A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF HOW MICROTRANSIT CAN BE SCALED AND DEPLOYED IN A RURAL SETTING. THIS WILL INCLUDE EVALUATING HOW EFFECTIVE MICROTRANSIT CAN BE AT COVERING SERVICE GAPS IN RURAL AREAS. DRPT WILL CAREFULLY DOCUMENT OUTCOMES AND WILL SHARE LESSONS LEARNED WITH FTA AND PARTNER AGENCIES. THE VIRGINIA MICROTRANSIT DEPLOYMENT INITIATIVE WILL ACCOMPLISH THESE GOALS BY WORKING CLOSELY WITH A MICROTRANSIT SOFTWARE AS A SERVICE PARTNER TO PROVIDE TWO PUBLIC TRANSIT AGENCIES WITH A MICROTRANSIT TECHNOLOGY PLATFORM. THE TECHNOLOGY PLATFORM WILL BE DEPLOYED AND INTEGRATED INTO TWO EXISTING DEVIATED FIXED ROUTES ONE FOR EACH PARTICIPATING TRANSIT AGENCY. TO MEASURE SUCCESS THE PROJECT WILL MONITOR CUSTOMER SATISFACTION CUSTOMER ADOPTION RATES AND SERVICE EFFICIENCY THROUGH DATA METRICS AND CUSTOMER SURVEYS. THE VIRGINIA MICROTRANSIT DEPLOYMENT INITIATIVE PROJECTS INTENDED IMPACTS ARE: - ENHANCED ACCESS TO SERVICE- INCREASED SERVICE EFFICIENCY- ENHANCED CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE- EMERGING TECHNOLOGIES

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO COMPLETE THE DEMONSTRATION PHASE OF THE MOBILITY PERFORMANCE METRICS PROJECT WHICH IS TO TEST VERIFY AND VALIDATE A SET OF SUPPLEMENTAL MOBILITY PERFORMANCE METRICS VIA PARTNERSHIP-BASED FIELD TESTING. ACTIVITIES UNDER THIS AWARD WILL FOLLOW PREVIOUS WORK ON MOBILITY PERFORMANCE METRICS INCLUDING THE 2020 REPORT MOBILITY PERFORMANCE METRICS (MPM) FOR INTEGRATED MOBILITY AND BEYONDWHICH DEVELOPED AND PRESENTED A SET OF TRAVELER-CENTRIC MOBILITY PERFORMANCE METRICS THAT ASSESS HOW WELL AN INTEGRATED PUBLIC/PRIVATE MOBILITY SYSTEM MEETS THE NEEDS OF INDIVIDUAL TRAVELERS HOW WELL THE SYSTEM PERFORMS WHILE MEETING OVERALL TRAVEL DEMAND AND WHAT THE SYSTEMS IMPACT IS LOCALLY AND NATIONALLY.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED UNDER THIS AWARD INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF A TEST PLAN TO EVALUATE VERIFY AND VALIDATE A SELECTED SET OF METRICS THROUGH PARTNERSHIP-BASED FIELD TESTING PILOT IMPLEMENTATION DATA COLLECTION ASSESSMENT EVALUATION DOCUMENTATION TARGET SETTING RESEARCH DEVELOPMENT OF MEASURES OF EFFECTIVENESS (MOES) AND DEVELOPMENT OF DATA AND TESTING PLATFORMS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF WORK PERFORMED UNDER THIS AWARD INCLUDE IMPROVED METHODS FOR CAPTURING TRANSITS VALUE TO INDIVIDUALS AND SOCIETY THROUGH TESTED AND VALIDATED SUPPLEMENTAL PERFORMANCE METRICS AND INCREASED KNOWLEDGE ON THE FEASIBILITY AND BENEFITS OF MEASURING MOBILITY PERFORMANCE METRICS IN ADDITION TO REQUIRED METRICS (FOR NTD OR STATE/LOCAL PURPOSES). IMPLEMENTATION OF THESE METRICS COULD ALSO LEAD TO IMPROVEMENT OF TRANSIT SYSTEMS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE PRIMARY BENEFICIARIES OF THIS AWARD WILL BE TRANSIT AGENCIES AND THEIR MOBILITY SERVICE PROVIDER PARTNERS. TRAVELERS AND THE PUBLIC WILL ALSO BENEFIT FROM TRANSIT AND MOBILITY SYSTEM IMPROVEMENTS THAT ARE MADE IN RESPONSE TO METRIC IMPLEMENTATION.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: TAMTI WILL SECURE THREE TO FOUR PARTNERSHIPS WITH TRANSIT AGENCIES TRANSPORTATION DEPARTMENTS OR PROVIDERS WHO HAVE DEMONSTRATED INTEREST AND EXPERIENCE WITH MULTIMODAL SERVICES SOME OF WHOM CURRENTLY PARTNER WITH ONE OR MORE MOBILITY SERVICE PROVIDERS (MSPS). THESE SUBRECIPIENTS WILL WORK WITH TEXAS AM TRANSPORTATION INSTITUTE TO CREATE A PLAN FOR AND CONDUCT PARTNERSHIP-BASED FIELD TESTING THAT WILL SPAN APPROXIMATELY TWELVE (12) MONTHS.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO TAKE ACTION TO PROTECT THE PUBLIC BY PROVIDING A CONTACTLESS PAYMENT SYSTEM TO MITIGATE THE SPREAD OF THE COVID-19 VIRUS FOR SUN METROS CUSTOMERS WHILE PROVIDING CUSTOMERS THE OPPORTUNITY TO CONDUCT SAFE FARE TRANSACTIONS.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO TAKE ACTION TO PROTECT THE PUBLIC BY PROVIDING A CONTACTLESS PAYMENT SYSTEM TO MITIGATE THE SPREAD OF THE COVID-19 VIRUS FOR SUN METROS CUSTOMERS WHILE PROVIDING CUSTOMERS THE OPPORTUNITY TO CONDUCT SAFE FARE TRANSACTIONS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE PROJECT WILL ALLOW SUN METRO TO IMPLEMENT A MULTI-MODEL PAYMENT INNOVATIVE MOBILITY SYSTEM. 1. PURPOSE: THE PROVISION OF ADDITIONAL PUBLIC SAFETY OFFICERS ON TRANSIT BUSES IS THE CRUX OF THE COMETS SAFETY CAMPAIGN. HAVING THESE OFFICERS ON BOARD WILL HELP TO IDENTIFY AND REDUCE ANY INSTANCES OF HUMAN TRAFFICKING PROTECT TRANSIT OPERATORS FROM RISK OF ASSAULT REDUCE CRIME ON TRANSIT VEHICLES AND AT TRANSIT FACILITIES AND IMPROVE RIDER AS WELL AS PUBLIC SAFETY. THE COMET IS CURRENTLY CONTRACTING WITH THE RICHLAND COUNTY SHERIFFS DEPARTMENT TO PROVIDE ONE OFFICER FOR 12 HOURS EACH DAY FOR SEVEN DAYS EACH WEEK. THIS ARRANGEMENT HAS SEEN A POSITIVE RESPONSE BY OUR PASSENGERS AS WELL AS THE COMMUNITIES WE SERVE. HOWEVER THIS ONLY ALLOWS FOR ONE OFFICER TO BE ON ANY OF OUR 39 FIXED ROUTES AT ANY GIVEN TIME.2. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE COMET IS ASKING FOR FUNDING TO PROVIDE ONE ADDITIONAL OFFICER TO FURTHER ENHANCE THE SAFETY MEASURES WE PROVIDE FOR OUR CUSTOMERS. THE SECOND ASPECT OF THE COMETS PROPOSAL WOULD BE FUNDING FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF MATERIALS RELATED TO RIDER SAFETY AND HUMAN TRAFFICKING AWARENESS AND PREVENTION. THESE WOULD BE PAMPHLETS POSTERS AND/OR OTHER HANDOUTS THAT COULD BE DISPLAYED BOTH ON THE BUSES AS WELL AS AT OUR TRANSIT CENTER AND HEAVILY USED TRANSIT SHELTERS. THESE MATERIALS WOULD ALSO BE ON DISPLAY AT PUBLIC SAFETY EVENTS AS DISCUSSED IN THE NEXT PARAGRAPH. THE FINAL PORTION OF THE COMETS PROPOSAL IS FOR FUNDING TO PROMOTE TRANSIT SAFETY AT THE COMET SPONSORED PUBLIC SAFETY EVENTS THROUGHOUT OUR SERVICE AREA. THESE EVENTS WOULD BE ADVERTISED THROUGH PRESS RELEASES AS WELL AS ON OUR WEBSITE ON SOCIAL MEDIA AT OUR TRANSIT CENTER AND ON BUSES.3. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THESE ACTIVITIES AND EVENTS WOULD ALLOW APPROPRIATE STAFF OR LAW ENFORCEMENT TO BE ON HAND TO EDUCATE THE PUBLIC ON AWARENESS OF HUMAN TRAFFICKING REDUCTION OF CRIME ON BUSES AND AT TRANSIT FACILITIES AND SAFETY OF TRANSIT OPERATORS.4. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THIS PROJECT WOULD RAISE RECOGNITION AND AWARENESS OF HUMAN TRAFFICKING FOR THOSE THAT MAY ENCOUNTER VICTIMS AS WELL AS PROVIDE RESOURCES AND AID FOR THE VICTIMS THEMSELVES.5. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE COMET CONTRACTS WITH LOCAL LAW ENFORCEMENT TO PROVIDE SECURITY SERVICES AND COMPETITIVELY PROCURES PRINTED MATERIALS. THE COMET WILL ENSURE CONTRACTORS PROCURED WILL NOT BE ON THE FTA SUSPENSION AND DEBARMENT LIST.THE COMET WILL FOLLOW ALL 3RD PARTY PROCUREMENT POLICIES AS DEFINED IN C4220.1F (THIRD PARTY CONTRACTING GUIDANCE)

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THIS PROJECT WILL DEVELOP AND TEST A MIDDLEWARE SOLUTION TO ENABLE REAL-TIME OPEN DATA EXCHANGE FOR DEMAND RESPONSE SOFTWARE USING TRANSACTION DATA STANDARD DEVELOPED AS A PART OF TCRP 210. THE MIDDLEWARE SOLUTION WILL ENABLE VARIOUS CLIENT MANAGEMENT AND SCHEDULING SOFTWARE TO SHARE CUSTOMER PROFILE AND ELIGIBILITY INFORMATION TRIP REQUESTS AND BOOKING CONFIRMATIONS PROVIDER AND VEHICLE INFORMATION AND TRIP PERFORMANCE STATUS.THE TEST WILL BE CONDUCTED AS A PART OF A ONE-STOP REGIONAL MOBILITY CENTER (RMC) CURRENTLY BEING IMPLEMENTED IN NORTHEAST AND SOUTHERN OHIO. THE RMC IS ENVISIONED TO PROVIDE A ONE EMI WORK PLAN AND STATEMENT OF WORK DEVELOP AND TEST A MIDDLEWARE SOLUTION TO ENABLE REAL-TIME OPEN DATA EXCHANGE FOR DEMAND RESPONSE SOFTWARE USING TRANSACTIONAL DATA STANDARD FOR EZCONNECT MOBILITY HUB STOP ACCESS TO CUSTOMERS AND AGENCIES SERVING THOSE CUSTOMERS WITH CLOUD-BASED OMNI-CHANNEL COMMUNICATIONS INFORMATION AND REFERRAL (IR) COMMON ELIGIBILITY DATABASE RESERVATION SCHEDULING TRIP BROKERAGE DISPATCHING AND SERVICE COORDINATION. LARGE AND SMALL TRANSIT AGENCIES HUMAN SERVICE AGENCIES AND THEIR CLIENTS WILL PARTICIPATE IN THIS TEST AND PROJECT IMPLEMENTATION.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THE PROPOSED PROJECT IS INTENDED TO DEMONSTRATE THE FEASIBILITY OF TECHNOLOGY-ENABLED REGIONAL SCALE MOBILITY PROGRAMS THAT CAN MANAGE ALL NON-FIXED ROUTE SERVICES IN A REGION ON A SINGLE PLATFORM EVEN WHEN MULTIPLE SYSTEMS ARE USED TO MANAGE A RANGE OF DEMAND RESPONSE TRANSPORT (DRT) SERVICES. FOR REGIONAL INTEGRATION TO BE POSSIBLE ALL OF THE DRT SOFTWARE SYSTEMS MUST BE CAPABLE OF INTEROPERATING WITH THE REGIONAL LEVEL PLATFORM SO THAT THE COLLECTIVE SET OF TRANSPORTATION RESOURCES CAN BE UTILIZED FOR TRIP REQUESTS. THE CURRENT INABILITY OF DIFFERENT DRT TECHNOLOGY SYSTEMS TO INTEROPERATE MEANS THAT A REGION WITH MULTIPLE DRT SERVICES CANNOT IMPLEMENT AN INTEGRATED APPROACH TO BOOKING SCHEDULING AND DELIVERING DEMAND RESPONSIVE FORMS OF PUBLIC TRANSIT. LACK OF SUCH STANDARDS-BASED INTERFACE HAS BEEN A MAJOR BARRIER FOR EFFICIENT MOBILITY MANAGEMENT AS DOCUMENTED IN CASE STUDIES OF MOBILITY SERVICE FOR ALL AMERICAN (MSAA) GRANTEES. WHILE NOVEL CONCEPT IN THE USA STANDARDS-BASED INTEROPERABILITY IS ACHIEVABLE IF (1) THE RELEVANT DRT SOFTWARE SYSTEMS ADOPT THE TDS FOR DEMAND RESPONSIVE TRANSPORTATION IN TCRP REPORT 210 (SEE APPENDIX 5) ; AND (2) A TECHNOLOGY PLATFORM IS IN PLACE TO ENABLE THESE SYSTEMS TO INTEROPERATE VIA THE TDS DATA PROTOCOLS. THE FLEXDENMARK PLATFORM IN DENMARK CONVINCINGLY DEMONSTRATES THIS INNOVATIVE PREMISE. IT USES A LONG ESTABLISHED SCANDINAVIAN VERSION OF THE PROPOSED TDSTHE SUTI STANDARDS AND IS ABLE TO MANAGE AND TRANSPORT UP TO 20000 TRIPS PER DAY IN AN INTEGRATED DENMARK-WIDE DRT PROGRAM. TRIPS ARE BOOKED VIA MANY DIFFERENT FRONT END SYSTEMS USED BY THE OVER 700 SERVICE SPONSORSMUNICIPALITIES TRANSIT AGENCIES HOSPITALS AND HEALTH CARE PROGRAMS HUMAN SERVICE AGENCIES SCHOOL SYSTEMSWHO ARE PART OF THE FLEXDENMARK ECOSYSTEM. TRIPS ARE THEN SCHEDULED AND ASSIGNED TO OVER 500 TRANSPORTATION SERVICE PROVIDERS INCLUDING BOTH PUBLIC TRANSPORT AGENCIES AND PRIVATE TRANSPORTATION OPERATORS (MOSTLY TAXI COMPANIES).; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: KEY BENEFITS OF THIS PROJECT TO DEVELOP AND TEST A MIDDLEWARE SOLUTION TO ENABLE REAL-TIME OPEN DATA EXCHANGE FOR DEMAND RESPONSIVE TRANSPORTATION (DRT) SOFTWARE USING TRANSACTIONAL DATA SPECIFICATIONS (TDS) ARE AS FOLLOWS: REDUCED COST OF OWNERSHIP OF SOFTWARE PROGRAMS THROUGH SYSTEM INTEROPERABILITY: THE PROJECT WILL DEMONSTRATE THAT IT IS TECHNICALLY AND OPERATIONALLY FEASIBLE TO SHARE TRIPS BETWEEN MULTIPLE DRT SERVICE PROVIDERS WITHOUT THE NEED FOR EXPENSIVE INTERFACES OR NEED TO IMPLEMENT COMPREHENSIVE BUT UNNECESSARY SOFTWARE PLATFORMS. EMI WORK PLAN AND STATEMENT OF WORK DEVELOP AND TEST A MIDDLEWARE SOLUTION TO ENABLE REAL-TIME OPEN DATA EXCHANGE FOR DEMAND RESPONSE SOFTWARE USING TRANSACTIONAL DATA STANDARD FOR EZCONNECT MOBILITY HUBMPROVED MOBILITY FOR UNDERSERVED: WITH THE HELP OF TDS-COMPLIANT SOFTWARE SYSTEMS AGENCIES CAN EXPAND TO UNDERSERVED REGIONS THROUGH CREATIVE PARTNERSHIPS AND SERVICES SUCH AS MICROTRANSIT OR UTILIZING SERVICES/VEHICLES FROM OTHER AGENCIES/PROVIDERS. REGIONAL MOBILITY PROGRAM EFFICIENCY: WITH TDS-COMPLIANT SYSTEMS REGIONAL SCALE DRT SERVICESSUCH AS FOR ADA PARATRANSIT HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION HEALTH CARE/MEDICAID TRANSPORTATION OR GENERAL PUBLIC DRTDONT NEED TO OPERATE IN THEIR OWN SILOS. ALL TDS-COMPLIANT SOFTWARE SYSTEMS WILL BE ABLE TO SUPPORT THE FULL DRT TRIP LIFECYCLE MAKING REGIONAL MOBILITY MANAGEMENT THROUGH A COMMON CALL CENTER FUNCTION POSSIBLE. SEAMLESS RIDER EXPERIENCE: TDS WILL MAKE IT POSSIBLE TO IMPROVE THE CURRENT FRAGMENTED EXPERIENCE IN TRIP PLANNING PLATFORMS MAAS SYSTEMS AND OTHER FRONT END SYSTEMS THAT ARE THE CONDUITS FOR BOOKING AND SCHEDULING OF DRT TRIPS. IT WILL ALLOW PLANNING BOOKING PAYMENT AND MANAGEMENT OF TRIPS WITHIN A SINGLE PLATFORM WITHOUT REQUIRING RELIANCE ON A SINGLE VENDOR. CLIMATE ACTION: AGENCIES CAN OPERATE FIXED ROUTE SERVICES ONLY WITHIN THEIR COUNTY BOUNDARIES. TDS-COMPLIANT SYSTEMS AND IMPLEMENTATION OF CREATIVE DRT AND MICROTRANSIT SERVICES WILL HELP EXPAND SERVICES THROUGH REGIONAL INTEROPERABILITY AND THUS POTENTIALLY REDUCING SINGLE OCCUPANCY VEHICLE USE AND VEHICLE MILES TRAVELED.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: KEY PARTNERS: ANN ARBOR AREA TRANSIT AUTHORITY BUTLER COUNTY RTA CATCH-A-RIDE COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY OF COLUMBIANA COUNTY STARK AREA REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY SOUTHWEST OHIO REGIONAL TRANSIT AUTHORITY TRANSIT AUTHORITY OF NORTHERN KENTUCKY WESTERN RESERVE TRANSIT AUTHORITY; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE FOLLOWING SUBRECIPIENTS WILL RECEIVE CAPITAL FUNDS TO MANAGE AND IMPLEMENT THE PROJECT: NEORIDE IBI GROUP REGIONAL MOBILITY GROUP AND DEMAND TRANS.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: DEMONSTRATION OF ENHANCED DATA INFRASTRUCTURE FOR MULTIMODAL PLANNING IN THE COVID-19 ENVIRONMENT TO IMPROVE PUBLIC CONFIDENCE IN TRANSIT SERVICE RELIABILITYTHIS PROJECT SEEKS TO USE DATA FROM THE COLUMBUS OH REGION TO UNDERSTAND HOW MOVEMENT PATTERNS OF THE COMMUNITY EVOLVED THROUGHOUT THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC AND HOW THE PUBLIC MOBILITY NETWORK KEPT PACE.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THIS PROJECT WILL DEVELOP A DATA MODEL INTEGRATING INTERNAL AND EXTERNAL DATASETS TO ANALYZE HOW COVID-19 CHANGED MOBILITY FLOWS HOW COTA THE TRANSIT AGENCY IN CENTRAL OHIO AND THE BROADER MULTIMODAL SYSTEM ADAPTED AND THE EFFECTIVENESS OF THOSE ADAPTATIONS. REFERRED TO AS THE MULTIMODAL PLANNING DATA (MPD) PROJECT THE GOAL IS TO DETERMINE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF MEETING THE COMMUNITYS MOBILITY NEEDS THROUGH A DATA-BASED APPROACH. THE TEAM IS COMPLETING THEIR DATA ANALYTICS WORK WHICH INCLUDES EFFECTIVENESS OF SERVICE PLANNING CHANGES ASSESSING THE FUTURE USE THE TOOL TO BETTER INFORM PLANNING DECISIONS CREATING AND UNDERSTANDING A COMPETITIVENESS RATIO THAT MEASURES HOW COMPETITIVE TRANSIT IS TO NON-TRANSIT OPTIONS MODE SPLITS FOR TRIPS WITHIN COTAS SERVICE AREA AND TRIP ORIGINS BY COMMUNITY. THE TEAM IS DEVELOPING LESSONS LEARNED AND WILL DELIVER THE DRAFT FINAL REPORT THIS UPCOMING QUARTER. THE PROJECT CAN PROVIDE INSIGHTS TO TRANSIT AGENCIES ON POSSIBLE DATA SOURCES AND ANALYSES TO BETTER UNDERSTAND TRAVEL FLOW AND HARNESS DATA-BASED INSIGHTS TO INFORM PLANNING.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: DETERMINE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF MEETING THE COMMUNITYS MOBILITY NEEDS THROUGH A DATA-BASED APPROACH AND DETERMINE HOW DATA ANALYTICS AND RELATED TOOLS CAN BETTER INFORM PLANNING DECISIONS INCLUDING THE EFFECTIVENESS OF SERVICE PLANNING CHANGES UNDERSTANDING HOW COMPETITIVE TRANSIT IS TO NON-TRANSIT OPTIONS. THE PROJECT CAN PROVIDE INSIGHTS TO TRANSIT AGENCIES ON POSSIBLE DATA SOURCES AND ANALYSES TO BETTER UNDERSTAND TRAVEL FLOW AND HARNESS DATA-BASED INSIGHTS TO INFORM PLANNING.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: N/A; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N/A

APPLICATION PURPOSE: TO PROVE THAT USING COMMUNITY-DRIVEN OPEN SOURCE TOOLS AND HAVING A CENTRAL PLACE TO DISCOVER SOURCES VALIDATE THEM AND COLLABORATE ON IMPROVING DATA LEADS TO IMPROVED DATA QUALITY AND ALLOWS PRODUCERS AND CONSUMERS TO COLLABORATE MORE EFFICIENTLY.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THIS PROJECT WILL FACILITATE COMMUNICATION AND COLLABORATION BETWEEN STAKEHOLDERS IN A CHOSEN GEOGRAPHICAL REGION (ONE FOR GTFS AND ONE FOR GBFS DATA). THESE REGIONS WILL WORK AS AN ECOSYSTEM IN WHICH MOBILITYDATA WILL ADDRESS DATA QUALITY BY:- FACILITATING COLLABORATION AMONG STAKEHOLDERS IN THE CHOSEN ECOSYSTEM- IDENTIFYING OPPORTUNITIES TO IMPROVE TRAVELER EXPERIENCE THROUGH DATA- PROVIDING RESOURCES TO CORRECT THE EXISTING ISSUES AND IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF THE DATA- IDENTIFYING DIFFERENT VERSIONS OF DATASETS COMPARE AND CENTRALIZE VERSIONS- IMPROVING THE DATA QUALITY TOOLS AND RESOURCES SO THAT STAKEHOLDERS CAN RELY ON THEM LONG TERM; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE PROJECT INTENDS TO PROVE THAT USING COMMUNITY-DRIVEN OPEN SOURCE TOOLS AND HAVING A CENTRAL PLACE TO DISCOVER SOURCES VALIDATE THEM AND COLLABORATE ON IMPROVING DATA LEADS TO IMPROVED DATA QUALITY AND ALLOWS PRODUCERS AND CONSUMERS TO COLLABORATE MORE EFFICIENTLY. THE LONG-TERM OUTCOME OF THE EMI PROJECT IS THAT WHEN AN INDIVIDUAL DATA CONSUMER CONTACTS A DATA PRODUCER TO FLAG AN ISSUE WITH A DATASET AUTOMATIC VALIDATION IN THE DATA CATALOG WOULD SIMULTANEOUSLY ALERT ALL PRODUCERS AND CONSUMERS THAT ARE IMPACTED BY THE ISSUE ENABLING GREATER ACCESS TO ACCURATE AND TIMELY TRANSIT DATA FOR ALL KINDS OF APPLICATIONS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: MOBILITYDATA WILL APPLY DATA QUALITY TOOLS TO THE DATASETS SUPPORTING ALL DATA PRODUCERS - BIG AND SMALL - TO IMPROVE THEIR DATA QUALITY BY PROVIDING TOOLS AND RESOURCES TAILORED TO THEIR NEEDS. DATA CONSUMERS WILL ALSO HAVE EQUAL ACCESS TO HIGH QUALITY DATA ENSURING THAT SERVICES FOCUSED ON SPECIFIC TRAVEL POPULATIONS OR TYPES OF TRIPS ARE GIVEN THE SAME LEVEL OF SUPPORT AS MORE GENERAL TRIP PLANNERS. INDIVIDUALS FROM ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE POPULATIONS MAKE UP A DISPROPORTIONATE SHARE OF TRANSIT RIDERS; THEY WILL DISPROPORTIONATELY BENEFIT FROM IMPROVEMENTS TO TRAVELER INFORMATION PARTICULARLY FROM UNDER-RESOURCED TRANSIT OPERATORS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE THE ROCHESTER GENESEE REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY AND ITS PARTNERS FUNDING FOR A RESEARCH PROJECT TO INVESTIGATE HOW TO OVERCOME CHALLENGES TO MAINTAINING ELIGIBILITY LISTS BY CONNECTING STATES DATABASES RUN BY SOCIAL PROGRAMS TO ENABLE AUTOMATED ENROLLMENT INTO LOW-INCOME FARE PROGRAMS. THIS PROJECT BRINGS TOGETHER A LARGE GROUP OF PARTNERS WHO ALL SEEK OUT THE SAME GOAL OF IMPROVING EQUITY THROUGH LOW-INCOME FARES WITHOUT OVERBURDENING TRANSIT AGENCIES IN ADMINISTERING THEM.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR PROJECT PARTNERS TO WORK TOGETHER WITH STATE AND LOCAL AGENCIES TO IDENTIFY APPLICABLE DATABASES THAT COULD ALLOW FOR CONNECTIONS AND RELEVANT POLICIES NEEDED TO PROTECT THE PRIVACY OF RIDERS. THE RESULT WILL BE A FINAL REPORT AND KNOWLEDGE TRANSFER ACTIVITIES WITH ACTIONABLE INFORMATION FOR TRANSIT AGENCIES ACROSS THE COUNTRY.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: INFORMATION FOR AGENCIES TO CREATE OR EXPAND LOW-INCOME QUALIFICATION PROGRAMS TO INCREASE RIDER ACCESS TO TRANSIT AND MOBILITY THROUGH REDUCED FARE PROGRAMS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THIS PROJECT SEEKS TO IMPROVE EQUITY OUTCOMES FOR RIDERS AT TRANSIT AGENCIES ACROSS THE U.S. THROUGH IMPROVING ACCESS TO LOW-INCOME FARES OR OTHER SIMILAR BENEFITS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THREE ADDITIONAL GRANTEE TRANSIT AGENCIES WILL PROVIDE SUPPORT ADVICE AND PROJECT STAFFING: DAYTON REGIONAL TRANSIT AUTHORITY (RTA) CENTRAL OHIO TRANSIT AUTHORITY (COTA) AND STARK AREA REGIONAL TRANSIT AUTHORITY (SARTA). NEORIDE WILL PROVIDE RESEARCH SUPPORT REVIEW AND EXPERTISE AS A SUPPORTING REGIONAL GOVERNMENT BODY. FOUR NINES TECHNOLOGIES WILL SERVE AS THE LEAD PRIVATE SECTOR RESEARCHER AND MASABI WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL EXPERTISE AS A PRIVATE SECTOR FARE COLLECTION SYSTEMS PROVIDER.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THIS PROJECT WILL COMPLETE A DEMONSTRATION AND STUDY OF INNOVATIVE CONTACTLESS PAYMENT SYSTEMS IN FIXED ROUTE TRANSIT BUSES. THE INSTALLATION OF NEW ELECTRONIC VALIDATORS ON 404 VEHICLES WILL REDUCE CUSTOMER INTERACTION POINTS AND MITIGATE RISK OF COVID-19 EXPOSURE FOR BOTH DRIVERS AND PASSENGERS. IN ADDITION TO INCREASING SAFETY AND EFFICIENCY THIS PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE RTCS GOAL OF REMAINING AT THE FOREFRONT OF EMERGING TECHNOLOGY AND IMPROVING THE PUBLIC TRANSIT EXPERIENCE FOR CUSTOMERS.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: ALIGNING WITH THE RTCS CURRENT FOCUS AREAS OF REDUCED HEALTH RISK AND IMPROVING CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL DEMONSTRATE THE IMPLEMENTATION AND BENEFITS OF TECHNOLOGICALLY ADVANCED CONTACTLESS PAYMENT SYSTEMS. THE RTC WILL EXPAND ITS EXISTING TECHNOLOGY THROUGH INSTALLING NEW VALIDATORS WITH EMV AND OPEN PAYMENT CAPABILITIES. A THIRD-PARTY EVALUATOR WILL CONTRACT WITH THE RTC TO DEVELOP AN EVALUATION PLAN THAT INCLUDES THE COLLECTION STORAGE AND ANALYSIS OF THE DATA COLLECTED.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE IMPLEMENTATION OF CONTACTLESS PAYMENT SYSTEMS SUPPORTS THE DEMONSTRATION AND DEVELOPMENT OF INNOVATIVE SOLUTIONS TO IMPROVE RTCS OPERATIONAL EFFICIENCY. THE UTILIZATION OF EMV (EUROPAY MASTERCARD VISA) AND OPEN PAYMENTS IS RELATIVELY NEW TO THE TRANSIT INDUSTRY AND WITH NEW VALIDATORS THE RTC WILL BE ABLE TO STRENGTHEN KNOWLEDGE FOR THE INDUSTRY USING REAL WORLD DATA AND ANALYTICS. OFFERING INNOVATIVE FARE PAYMENT SOLUTIONS SUPPORTS ENHANCED MOBILITY THROUGH INNOVATIVE AND EFFICIENT PAYMENT OPTIONS AND SIMULTANEOUSLY REDUCES COVID-19 EXPOSURE. THE RTC IS FOCUSED ON IMPROVING THE SAFETY AND PERFORMANCE OF THE ENTIRE TRANSIT SYSTEM BECAUSE OF ITS CENTRAL ROLE IN THE REGIONS OVERALL ECONOMY. BY REMOVING THE NECESSITY FOR INTERACTION POINTS AND CASH PAYMENT EXCHANGES WE WILL INCREASE SAFETY AND REDUCE DWELL TIME AND PASSENGER LOADING TIMES. OUTCOME MEASUREMENTS WILL BE QUANTIFIABLE AND DEMONSTRATE A POSITIVE IMPACT AS CUSTOMERS GAIN CONFIDENCE THROUGH IMPROVED TRANSPORTATION.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE RIDERS AND DRIVERS OF THE RTC BUS SYSTEM.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO SUB-RECIPIENT ACTIVITIES.

THE DIGITAL TWIN TECHNOLOGY WILL ALSO IDENTIFY STRUCTURAL/VISUAL CHANGES THAT WOULD INDICATE DAMAGE TO BUS STOPS AND AMENITIES.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE RENO SPARKS AND WASHOE COUNTY NEVADA GREATER COMMUNITIES.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NO SUBRECIPIENT.

THIS PROJECT WILL UTILIZE $450000 OF SECTION 5312 COVID-19 RESEARCH DEMONSTRATION COMPETITIVE FUNDING TO SUPPORT A STATEWIDE VANPOOL PROGRAM. THESE FUNDS WILL ASSIST COMMUTE WITH ENTERPRISE TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT A PILOT VANPOOLING PROGRAM TO TRANSPORT INDIVIDUALS TO AND FROM WORK. THE PURPOSE OF THIS VANPOOL PROGRAM IS TO INCREASE USE OF VANPOOLS THROUGHOUT MISSOURI TO ASSIST IN THE PANDEMIC RECOVERY AND INCREASE JOB ACCESS. THE SPECIFIC LOCATIONS WILL FOCUS ON BOTH RURAL AND URBAN AREAS THAT HAVE LIMITED OR NO PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS AVAILABLE FOR COMMUTE TRIPS. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO WORK WITH EMPLOYERS THROUGHOUT THE STATE TO SERVE COMMUTERS IN AREAS SUFFERING FROM ECONOMIC DISPARITIES TRANSIT DEPENDENCY OR JOB ACCESS ISSUES. THIS PILOT PROGRAM WILL UTILIZE VANPOOLING TO TRANSPORT INDIVIDUALS TO AND FROM WORK EXPAND JOB ACCESS AND UTILIZE STATE-OF-THE-ART TECHNOLOGY TO HELP RIDERS MATCH AND PAY IN REAL-TIME AND IN A HEALTHY CONTACTLESS WAY. $22500 WILL BE FEDERALLY FUNDED AT 100 PERCENT FOR ADMINISTRATION FEES AND $427500 WILL BE FEDERALLY FUNDED FOR THE PILOT PROGRAM.PURPOSE: THE PROPOSED SERVICE WILL UTILIZE VANPOOL PROJECTS THROUGHOUT MISSOURI TO ASSIST THE PANDEMIC RECOVERY AND PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS TO INDIVIDUALS THAT HAVE LIMITED OR NO PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION AVAILABLE TO AND FROM WORK. THE SPECIFIC LOCATIONS WILL FOCUS ON BOTH RURAL AND URBAN AREAS. THE PROJECT WILL WORK WITH EMPLOYERS THROUGHOUT THE STATE TO SERVE COMMUTERS IN AREAS SUFFERING FROM ECONOMIC DISPARITIES. THE PILOT PROGRAM WILL UTILIZE VANPOOLING TO GET INDIVIDUALS TO AND FROM WORK EXPAND JOB ACCESS AND UTILIZE STATE-OF-THE-ART TECHNOLOGY TO HELP RIDERS MATCH AND PAY IN REAL-TIME. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED (DETAILS IN THE SOW):VOLUNTARY USE OF VEHICLE CLEANING AND DISINFECTION REDUCE EXPOSURE USE OF INNOVATIVE MOBILITY TOOLS FOR FARE COLLECTION AND DATA REPORTING USEGAIN AND STRENGTHEN PUBLIC CONFIDENCE IN TRANSPORTATION INCREASE ACCESS TO EMPLOYMENT GENERATE LOCAL SHARE FOR ADDITIONAL PROJECTSEXPECTED OUTCOMES: INCREASE NUMBER OF RIDES AND TRIPS (GROWTH - INCREASE VANPOOLS) STRENGTHEN PUBLIC CONFIDENCE INCREASE ACCESS TO EMPLOYMENT. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: VANPOOLING WITH COMMUTE WITH ENTERPRISE ADDRESSES THE PROBLEMS IDENTIFIED EARLIER IN THIS STATEMENT OF WORK. VANPOOL PROGRAMS INCREASE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR EVERYONE IN THE COMMUNITY THROUGH USE OF THE MODE AND INCREASING TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS. SEVERAL ACTIVITIES WILL BE TRACKED TO ENSURE THIS PROJECT WILL BE A SUCCESS AS DESCRIBED IN THE ATTACHED SOW.

ADAS PROJECT PERFORMANCE PERIOD NEEDS TO BE EXTENDED FOR THE FOLLOWING REASONS.: THE REASONS FOR ANOTHER EXTENSION INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING:1)THE BASELINE DATA COLLECTION BEING INCOMPLETE AND TAKING MORE THAN EXPECTED BECAUSE KCATAS THREE TEST BUSES WERE NOT ON THE PROSPECT MAX ROUTE AND SOMETIMES TEST BUSES WERE OUT FOR MAINTENANCE. APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO TEST TWO CONTACTLESS PAYMENT SYSTEMS IN ORDER TO BETTER UNDERSTAND THEIR IMPACT ON REAL AND PERCEIVED PASSENGER SAFETY IN FARE COLLECTION DURING THE COVID PANDEMIC.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: MNDOT WILL TAKE ADVANTAGE OF AN ALREADY PLANNED TEST OF A FARE CARD-BASED PAYMENT SYSTEM WITH THREE 5311 RURAL TRANSIT SYSTEMS AND EXPAND TO TEST A MOBILE DEVICE PAYMENT SYSTEM WITH FIVE ADDITIONAL 5311 SYSTEMS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: BY DEPLOYING THE LEADING CONTACTLESS PAYMENT SOLUTIONS SIDE-BY-SIDE MNDOT HOPES TO BETTER UNDERSTAND THE ADVANTAGES AND LIMITATIONS OF EACH TECHNOLOGY FOR RURAL TRANSIT RIDERS AS A PROOF OF CONCEPT TO HELP GUIDE TECHNOLOGY INVESTMENT AS IT IMPLEMENTS ITS STATEWIDE TRANSIT TECHNOLOGY PLAN IN THE COMING YEARS. IN THE SECOND YEAR OF THE PROJECT MNDOT WILL ALSO PROVIDE A DIGITAL TRIP PLANNING SOLUTION TO RIDERS TAKING ADVANTAGE OF THE TRIP PLANNING FUNCTIONALITY BEING DEVELOPED IN THE SOUTHERN MINNESOTA MOBILITY-AS-A-SERVICE (MAAS) PROJECT FUNDED BY FTA AIM FUNDS. IN ADDITION PLANNED RESEARCH BY THE UNIVERSITY OF MINNESOTA INTO PUBLIC PERCEPTIONS OF THE SAFETY OF TRANSIT AROUND COVID IN GREATER MINNESOTA WILL BE EXPANDED TO FOCUS SPECIFICALLY ON THE ROLE OF CONTACTLESS PAYMENT AND REAL TIME TRAVEL DATA ON RIDERS OF PARTICIPATING SYSTEM.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THIS RIDER RESEARCH WILL HELP TRANSIT AGENCIES DETERMINE THE BEST TECHNOLOGIES AND STRATEGIES TO IMPLEMENT IN ORDER TO RAPIDLY GAIN BACK PUBLIC CONFIDENCE IN TRANSIT POST-COVID.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NO FUNDING WILL PASS TO SUBRECIPIENTS HOWEVER MNDOT WILL ENTER INTO PARTNERSHIP AGREEMENTS WITH TRANSIT ENTITIES FOR REASEARCH AND EXPERIMENTATION FOR SHARING FACILITIES EQUIPMENT STAFF OR OTHER MEANS OF PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION RELATED SERVICES.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO BUILD A REGIONAL MOBILITY-AS-A-SERVICE (MAAS) PLATFORM FOR SOUTHERN MINNESOTA TO TEST HOW SUCH A PLATFORM CAN IMPROVE COORDINATION OF TRANSIT SERVICES AND PRIVATE SECTOR SHARED MOBILITY ACROSS A DIVERSE AREA COVERING RURAL SUBURBAN AND URBAN ENVIRONMENTS.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: MNDOT WILL PARTNER WITH EIGHT TRANSIT AGENCIES PRIVATE SECTOR PROVIDERS OF INTERCITY BUS SERVICE AND ADDITIONAL SHARED MOBILITY PROVIDERS TO OFFER A DIGITAL PLATFORM WHERE RESIDENTS AND VISITORS CAN PLAN BOOK AND PAY FOR AND TRACK TRIPS IN A SINGLE PLACE. APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS REQUEST IS FOR A PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE EXTENSION THROUGH JUNE 30 2024.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THE MONTGOMERY COUNTY MD PROJECT LEAD CYRUS BEHROOZ WILL WORK WITH ITS PARTNER MOOVIT AND SUBCONTRACTORS TO RESEARCH DEVELOP AND DEMONSTRATE REAL-TIME CROWD SOURCING TO THE PUBLIC VIA A SMARTPHONE APP. THIS INFORMATION WILL ALSO BE PROVIDED TO THE CENTRAL DISPATCH IN ORDER TO DISPATCH ANOTHER BUS TO AN OVERCROWDED ROUTE PRIOR TO THE NEXT SCHEDULED SERVICE FOR THAT ROUTE. THE TASKS OF THIS PROJECT FOR THE FTA WILL BE LED BY MONTGOMERY COUNTY TRANSIT SERVICES DIVISION. THE MONTGOMERY COUNTY PROJECT LEAD WILL ACT AS THE RESEARCH LEAD AND WORK WITH THE STAKEHOLDERS WITHIN THE TRANSIT SERVICES DIVISION AND ITS PARTNERS. IN THE RESEARCH PHASE THE PROJECT LEAD WILL HELP IDENTIFY CURRENT CROWD SOURCING APPROACHES COMPARED TO THE ROCCS APPROACH. THE DEVELOPMENT PHASE WILL BE THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE APPLICATION SOFTWARE AND SOFTWARE TO INTERFACE WITH THE IN-VEHICLE HARDWARE (AUTOMATIC PASSENGER COUNTERS CELLULAR ROUTER AND CAD/AVL SYSTEM) TO PROVIDE A SMARTPHONE APP WITH REAL-TIME PASSENGER INFORMATION. IN THE DEMONSTRATION PHASE THE ROCCS APPROACH WILL DEMONSTRATE THE IMPROVEMENT OF A REAL-TIME AUTOMATED CROWD SOURCING COMPARED TO THE CURRENT MANUAL CROWD SOURCING APPROACH. AFTER THE DEMONSTRATION A RECOMMENDATION WILL BE PROVIDED BASED UPON THE RESULTS FROM THE DEMONSTRATION PHASE AND INCLUDE HOW AGENCIES THAT HAVE ITS SYSTEMS (CAD/AVL) AND AGENCIES THAT ONLY HAVE PASSENGER COUNTERS AND WIRELESS ROUTERS CAN PROVIDE REAL-TIME CROWD SOURCING TO THEIR RIDERSHIP.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE RESEARCH THIS PROJECT PROVIDES INCLUDES HOW EFFECTIVE ALTERNATIVE TRIP PLANNING AS WELL AS STRATEGIC STAGING OF VEHICLES TO DEPLOY WHEN OCCUPANCY MAXIMUMS ARE REACHED TO HELP OTHER AGENCIES DETERMINE BEST PRACTICES AND THE EFFECTIVITY OF DEPLOYING THESE TYPES OF TECHNIQUES IN PASSENGER NOTIFICATION TO MAKE TRANSIT RIDERSHIP MORE APPEALING FROM A SAFETY PERSPECTIVE.THE PROJECT INTENDS TO DEMONSTRATE HOW A MOBILE APPLICATION THAT WILL ASSIST TO REDUCE CROWDS ON RIDE ON BUSES. THE PROJECT WILL INCLUDE A FINAL REPORT ON THE RIDE ON CROWD SOURCING SYSTEM. THE FINAL REPORT WILL INCORPORATE FTA COMMENTS ON THE DRAFT REPORT. THE DRAFT REPORT WILL INCLUDE DASHBOARD DATA ON RIDERSHIP AND USE OF THE ROCSS CAPABILITY CUSTOMER FEEDBACK AND RECOMMENDATIONS TO IMPROVE ROCSS AND RELEASE AT OTHER TRANSIT AGENCIES.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: MONTGOMERY COUNTY RESIDENTS THAT USE TRANSIT SERVICES. THE TRANSIT RIDERSHIP IN THE MARYLAND AREA WOULD HAVE ACCESS TO MORE PROVEN REAL-TIME INFORMATION ABOUT THE AVAILABILITY OF SEATS ON TRANSIT SERVICE THAT ARE APPROPRIATELY SOCIALLY DISTANCED FROM OTHERS OUTSIDE THEIR FAMILY GROUP. BY USING THIS SAME DATA TO STRATEGICALLY ADD VEHICLES FOR SERVICE WHEN NEEDED DUE TO OVERCROWDING MORE SAFE TRANSIT OPTIONS WOULD BE AVAILABLE TO RIDERS IN A USER-FRIENDLY FORMAT. AND THE EVENT THAT ALL BUSES WERE OPERATING AT CAPACITY FOR THE SITUATION THIS SAME USER-FRIENDLY APP WOULD ALLOW THE RIDERS TO EXPLORE ALTERNATIVE TRANSIT OPTION IN THE AREA FOR THEIR TRAVEL DESTINATION. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO SERVE AS A DEMONSTRATION OF ALTERNATIVE TRIP PLANNING FOR OTHER TRANSIT AGENCIES.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: BELOW ARE THE PROJECT ACTIVITIES THAT WILL BE IMPLEMENTED BY MONTGOMERY COUNTY IN PARTNERSHIP WITH MOOVIT AND SUBCONTRACTORS TO RESEARCH DEVELOP AND DEMONSTRATE REAL-TIME CROWD SOURCING TO THE PUBLIC VIA A SMARTPHONE APP. THE INDYGO MOBILITY CONCIERGE PROJECT WILL SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THE FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION (FTA) AND THE US DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATIONS ACCELERATING INNOVATIVE MOBILITY (AIM) INITIATIVE BY INTRODUCING AN ADVANCED METHOD OF TRIP PLANNING AND PAYMENT TO THE INDIANAPOLIS AREA WHICH SEEKS TO IMPROVE OVERALL ACCESSIBILITY TO CENTRAL INDIANA. THE INDIANAPOLIS PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION CORPORATION (INDYGO) WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH KEY PROJECT PARTNERS SUCH AS A LOCAL BIKESHARE PROVIDER AND OTHER AREA MOBILITY PROVIDERS TO SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETE THIS PROJECT. FTA AND THE USDOTS AIM INITIATIVE PROVIDES FEDERAL RESEARCH FUNDS TO PROJECT TEAMS TO DEMONSTRATE INNOVATIVE EFFECTIVE APPROACHES PRACTICES AND TECHNOLOGIES THAT ENHANCE EFFECTIVENESS INCREASE EFFICIENCY EXPAND QUALITY PROMOTE SAFETY AND ULTIMATELY IMPROVE THE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION RIDERS EXPERIENCE. THE GOAL OF THE MOBILITY CONCIERGE IS TO ENABLE SEAMLESS TRIP BOOKING AND PAYMENT ACROSS MULTIPLE MODES OF TRANSPORTATION AND TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS WITHIN CENTRAL INDIANA INCLUDING THE BROKERING OF FIRST/LAST-MILE SERVICES TO PROVIDE THE LOWEST-COST TRIP. THE PROJECT WILL ACCOMPLISH THESE GOALS THROUGH TASKS INCLUDING:ENGAGING AREA DEMAND-RESPONSE PROVIDERS AND MOBILITY PROVIDERSISSUING AN REQUEST FOR PROPOSALS FOR MOBILITY INTEGRATION PLATFORMSDEVELOPING THE MOBILITY CONCIERGE AND BROKERING SERVICE BY LEVERAGING BOTH EXISTING AND NEW ASSETSDEPLOYING MYKEY AND THE SUBSEQUENT TRANSIT FARE ACCOUNTSCUSTOMER EDUCATION AND SERVICE MARKETINGDEPLOYMENT OF THE MOBILE INTEGRATION PLATFORM AND MOBILITY CONCIERGE WITHIN ONE YEAREVALUATION REPORTING AND SHARING LESSONS LEARNED FROM THE PROJECTTHE MOBILITY CONCIERGE AND INTEGRATION PROJECTS INTENDED IMPACTS INCLUDE: INCREASED ACCESS FOR SENIORS STUDENTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH LIMITED PERSONAL MOBILITYIMPROVED EQUITY AND ACCESSIBILITY TO PUBLIC TRANSITIMPROVED ACCESS TO ECONOMIC HEALTHCARE AND EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES ON A REGIONAL SCALEESTABLISH THE ABILITY TO BOOK AND PAY FOR TRIPS ACROSS MULTIPLE MODES OF TRANSPORTATION AND MOBILITY PROVIDERSESTABLISH THE ABILITY TO PLAN FOR TRIPS ACROSS MULTIPLE MODES OF TRANSPORTATION SPECIAL CONDITIONSALL VEHICLES USED IN A FIXED ROUTE SERVICE MUST BE ACCESSIBLE TO AND USABLE BY PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES INCLUDING WHEELCHAIR USERS ACCORDING TO 49 CFR PART 38. PER 49 CFR 37.77(B) INACCESSIBLE VEHICLES MAY BE ACQUIRED FOR AND USED IN A DEMAND RESPONSIVE SERVICE ONLY WHEN EQUIVALENT SERVICE TO PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES INCLUDING WHEELCHAIR USERS CAN BE PROVIDED ACCORDING TO THE CRITERIA ESTABLISHED UNDER 49 CFR 37.77(C). THE PROJECT MUST ADHERE TO BUY AMERICA REQUIREMENTS.LOCAL SHARETHE LOCAL SHARE OF THIS AWARD MAY BE DEFERRED AS NECESSARY CONSISTENT WITH THE PROJECT MILESTONE SCHEDULE. THE RECIPIENT WILL BE REIMBURSED FOR ACTUAL COSTS AS DETAILED IN THE PROJECT MILESTONE SCHEDULE AND PROJECT BUDGET. THE RECIPIENT AGREES THAT IT WILL MAINTAIN ADEQUATE COST RECORDS TO SUPPORT ANY PAYMENT REQUEST TO FTA AND THAT THE PAYMENT REQUESTED WILL NOT EXCEED THE FEDERAL SHARE OF THE COSTS ACTUALLY INCURRED FOR THE MILESTONE. PURPOSE: THE FAIR TRANSIT PROGRAM LOCATED IN SOUTH COOK COUNTY WILL SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THE FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION (FTA) AND THE US DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (USDOT)S ACCELERATING INNOVATIVE MOBILITY (AIM) PROGRAM THROUGH A PILOT THAT WILL REDUCE FARES IMPROVE SERVICE AND ALLOW SEAMLESS TRANSIT USE ACROSS PUBLIC TRANSIT AGENCIES IN THE REGION. THE PROGRAM WILL BETTER CONNECT RESIDENTS TO JOBS AND KEY DESTINATIONS ADDRESS THE DECLINING RIDERSHIP OF VULNERABLE POPULATIONS ALONG THE METRA ELECTRIC AND ROCK ISLAND DISTRICT COMMUTER RAIL LINES AND FOSTER POST-COVID-19 RECOVERY. THE COOK COUNTY DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION AND HIGHWAYS (CCDOTH) WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH METRA PACE AND THE CHICAGO TRANSIT AUTHORITY (CTA) ON THE PROJECT. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: A KEY INITIATIVE WILL BE TO ENGAGE RESIDENTS IN COOK AND WILL COUNTIES MOST LIKELY TO BENEFIT FROM THESE ENHANCED TRANSIT SERVICES BEFORE AND DURING THE PILOT TO TRACK KEY METRICS NEEDED TO DETERMINE OVERALL SUCCESS. THE INITIATIVE NAMED ENGAGING SOUTH COOK RESIDENTS TO ADVANCE FAIR TRANSIT WILL DEVELOP AN INNOVATIVE AND ROBUST PUBLIC ENGAGEMENT PLAN; DEPLOY A SERIES OF SURVEYS TO COLLECT DATA; TRACK THE PERFORMANCE OF COVID-19 RECOVERY STRATEGIES; AND EVALUATE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF DIFFERENT TYPES OF PUBLIC ENGAGEMENT THE IMPACTS OF THE THREE-YEAR FAIR TRANSIT PILOT AND THE IMPACTS OF POST COVID-19 RECOVERY STRATEGIES ON RIDERSHIP. THE ROBUST OUTREACH STRATEGY WILL ACCOMPLISH THESE GOALS THROUGH:RESIDENT EDUCATION AND MARKETING OUTREACH EVENTS DEPLOYMENT OF VIRTUAL AND PAPER-BASED SURVEY TOOLS PAID MEDIA ADVERTISEMENTSEVALUATION AND ITERATION OF PUBLIC ENGAGEMENT STRATEGIES AND REPORTING AND SHARING LESSONS LEARNED FROM THE PROJECT. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: BY ENGAGING WITH PARTICIPANTS BEFORE AND DURING THE PILOT CCDOTH WILL EVALUATE THE IMPACTS OF THE PROJECT WHICH COULD INCLUDE: INCREASED EQUITY AND ACCESSIBILITY ON PUBLIC TRANSIT THROUGH REDUCED FARES AND FARE INTEGRATION BETWEEN PUBLIC TRANSIT AGENCIES;IMPROVED PUBLIC TRANSIT EFFICIENCY THROUGH IMPROVED SERVICE;GROWING PARTICIPATION BY COMMUNITY RESIDENTS OVER THE COURSE OF THE PROJECT; ANDA GREATER INCREASE IN TRANSIT RIDERSHIP OVER THE COVID-19 RECOVERY WITHIN THE PROJECT AREA COMPARED TO THE REGION.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE PROJECT IS INTENDED TO BENEFIT LOWER-INCOME BLACK AND LATINX TRANSIT USERS FOR WHOM FARES ARE RELATIVELY UNAFFORDABLE AND FOR WHOM AVAILABLE TRANSIT SERVICE IS INCONVENIENT. THIS APPLICATION INCLUDES FUNDS FOR RESEARCH AND/OR DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES. FEDERAL ROLE: THE FTA WILL ACTIVELY PARTICIPATE IN THE PROJECT ACTIVITIES SUCH AS ATTENDING REVIEW MEETINGS COMMENTING ON TECHNICAL REPORTS AND MAINTAINING FREQUENT CONTACT WITH THE LOCAL PROJECT MANAGER. FTA RESERVES THE RIGHT TO RE-DIRECT PROJECT ACTIVITIES AND FUNDING FOR THE PROJECT SUPPORTED UNDER THIS AWARD AND THEIR RELATED ACTIVITIES. RECIPIENT ROLE: THE COOK COUNTY DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION AND HIGHWAYS ALONG WITH THEIR PROJECT PARTNERS WILL MANAGE THE PROJECT AS OUTLINED IN THE STATEMENT OF WORK INCLUDING PREPARATION OF TECHNICAL STATUS AND FINANCIAL REPORTS AND SUBMITTING DELIVERABLES TO FTA. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONESPECIAL CONDITIONSALL VEHICLES USED IN A FIXED ROUTE SERVICE MUST BE ACCESSIBLE TO AND USABLE BY PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES INCLUDING WHEELCHAIR USERS ACCORDING TO 49 CFR PART 38. PER 49 CFR 37.77(B) INACCESSIBLE VEHICLES MAY BE ACQUIRED FOR AND USED IN A DEMAND RESPONSIVE SERVICE ONLY WHEN EQUIVALENT SERVICE TO PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES INCLUDING WHEELCHAIR USERS CAN BE PROVIDED ACCORDING TO THE CRITERIA ESTABLISHED UNDER 49 CFR 37.77(C). THE PROJECT MUST ADHERE TO BUY AMERICA REQUIREMENTS.LOCAL SHARETHE LOCAL SHARE OF THIS AWARD MAY BE DEFERRED AS NECESSARY TO BE CONSISTENT WITH THE PROJECT MILESTONE SCHEDULE. THE RECIPIENT WILL BE REIMBURSED FOR ACTUAL COSTS AS DETAILED IN THE PROJECT MILESTONE SCHEDULE AND PROJECT BUDGET. THE RECIPIENT AGREES THAT IT WILL MAINTAIN ADEQUATE COST RECORDS TO SUPPORT ANY PAYMENT REQUEST TO FTA AND THAT THE PAYMENT REQUESTED WILL NOT EXCEED THE FEDERAL SHARE OF THE COSTS ACTUALLY INCURRED FOR THE MILESTONE. COMPLIANCE WITH OTHER FEDERAL PROVISIONSTHE RECIPIENT SHALL COMPLY WITH THE REQUIREMENTS OF FTA CIRCULAR 6100.1E RESEARCH TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND TRAINING PROGRAM: APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS AND PROGRAM MANAGEMENT GUIDELINES HTTPS://WWW.TRANSIT.DOT.GOV/SITES/FTA.DOT.GOV/FILES/DOCS/FTA_CIR_6100.1E.DOCX_4.08.2015_%282%29_0.PDF .THE RECIPIENT IS RESPONSIBLE FOR AWARDING OR MANAGING ANY THIRD-PARTY CONTRACTS OR PARTNERING ARRANGEMENTS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS PROJECT IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE REQUIREMENTS OF FTA CIRCULAR 4220.1F THIRD PARTY CONTRACTING REQUIREMENTS.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE GUAM REGIONAL TRANSIT AUTHORITY (GRTA) KOKO BIRDS AIM FOR THE FUTURE FREEDOM OF MOBILITY PROJECT IS A RESEARCH EFFORT FUNDED UNDER FTAS ACCELERATING INNOVATIVE MOBILITY (AIM) PROGRAM IT WILL PROVIDE INNOVATIVE AND INCLUSIVE MOBILITY ON DEMAND (MOD) PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO CONNECT CITIZENS AND MILITARY PERSONNEL OF RURAL SOUTHWESTERN VILLAGES AND THE US NAVAL BASE GUAM (NBG) TO THE ISLANDS COMMERCIAL CENTERS. THE MOD SERVICE WILL PROVIDE THESE AREAS WITH INNOVATIVE AND INCLUSIVE ACCESS FOR RESIDENTS OF THREE RURAL COMMUNITIES (AGAT SANTA RITA PITI) AND NBG TO HAGATNA THROUGH SOUTHERN DEDEDO THE ISLANDS PRIMARY COMMERCIAL EMPLOYMENT (OPPORTUNITY ZONE) AND HEALTHCARE AREAS.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: GRTA WILL ACQUIRE ADA-ACCESSIBLE VEHICLES FOR OPERATIONS PROVIDE CUSTOMER-FOCUSED ACCESS TO SERVICE THROUGH ADVANCED TECHNOLOGY CREATE A NEWLY BRANDED SERVICE AND PROVIDE THE CUSTOMER WITH COMPLETE TRIP CONCIERGE SERVICES. GRTA WILL PROVIDE INNOVATIVE ON-DEMAND CUSTOMER TRIP SCHEDULING SERVICE MANAGEMENT AND PAYMENT SERVICES THROUGH A MOBILE APPLICATION (APP) AND EXISTING WEBSITE. GRTA WILL ALSO PROVIDE ALL CUSTOMERS INCLUDING UNBANKED AND UNDERBANKED PERSONS WITH ACCESS TO THESE SERVICES BY TELEPHONE AND IN-PERSON AT GRTA OFFICES WITH ADDITIONAL OUTLETS TO BE DETERMINED DURING THE SERVICE PREPARATION PHASE. GRTAS MARKET RESEARCH COMPONENT LED BY THE UNIVERSITY OF GUAM WILL EVALUATE AND STUDY THE MOD SERVICE INCLUDING DEMOGRAPHICS RIDER PREFERENCE DATA ANALYSIS AND LESSONS LEARNED. THE REPORT WILL ADDRESS THE CHALLENGES AND SUCCESSES OF THE PILOT PROJECT AS A DOCUMENTED STUDY WITH AN INDEPENDENT COLLEGIATE LEVEL ANALYSIS IN SOLUTIONS FOR FUTURE INNOVATIONS ON MOBILITY ON GUAM. THE RESULTS WILL ALLOW GRTA TO REPLICATE THE SUCCESSES OF THE PILOT FOR OTHER ISLAND COMMUNITIES AND ON GUAM.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE PROJECTS INTENDED IMPACTS INCLUDE: INCREASED ACCESS FOR SENIORS STUDENTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH LIMITED PERSONAL MOBILITY IMPROVED EQUITY AND ACCESSIBILITY TO PUBLIC TRANSIT IMPROVED SAFETY AND EFFICIENCY USE OF PUBLIC-PRIVATE PARTNERSHIPS FOR DEMONSTRATION DATA SHARING AND KNOWLEDGE TRANSFER BY PROVIDING NEW SAFE AND INCLUSIVE RURAL PUBLIC TRANSIT SERVICES ON THE ISLAND OF GUAM FOR THE TOWNS OF AGAT (POPULATION 4917) SANTA RITA (POPULATION 6084) AND PITI (POPULATION 1454) WHO EXPERIENCED A 15-25% POPULATION DECLINE FROM THE YEARS 2000-2010 AND CITE NEEDS FOR ACCESS TO EMPLOYMENT HEALTHCARE SHOPPING AND LIFES NEEDS. INNOVATIVE SERVICE DELIVERY MODEL OF AN UBER-LIKE SHUTTLE SERVICE NOVEL PARTNERSHIPS CUSTOMER-FOCUSED COMPLETE TRIP TECHNOLOGY FOR RURAL AND MILITARY COMMUNITIES CUSTOMER-FOCUSED ACCESS TO SERVICE THROUGH ADVANCED TECHNOLOGY; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: GRTAS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE NEW INNOVATIVE ON-DEMAND COMPLETE TRIP TRANSIT SERVICES FOR RURAL AND MILITARY COMMUNITIES UTILIZING ADVANCED INCLUSIVE TECHNOLOGY.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE PROJECT TEAM WILL PARTNER WITH MOBILITY PROVIDES AS OUTLINED IN THE AIM COMPETITIVE APPLICATION.

THESE ARE FY2019 SECTION 5312 LAPSING FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $100240. THE FUNDS ARE MATCHED WITH LOCAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $25060. HART IS PARTNERING WITH REDEFINING REFUGE OF TAMPA INC. TO CREATE A HUMAN TRAFFICKING AWARENESS CAMPAIGN IN GREATER TAMPA BAY DURING THE MONTHS LEADING UP TO SUPER BOWL IN 2021.REDEFINING REFUGE OF TAMPA IS A SPECIALIZED NON-PROFIT SERVICE PROVIDER AND ADVOCACY AGENCY FOR SEXUALLY EXPLOITED AND TRAFFICKED YOUTH. THE PARTNERSHIP WITH HART WILL RAISE AWARENESS OF HUMAN TRAFFICKING AND ITS NEGATIVE IMPACTS ACROSS THE TAMPA BAY AREA BY CREATING AN ADVERTISEMENT CAMPAIGN SERIES.THE OUTREACH CAMPAIGN WILL BE DESIGNED TO EDUCATE THE TAMPA BAY COMMUNITY ABOUT THE PREVALENCE AND DANGERS OF HUMAN TRAFFICKING. A TYPOGRAPHIC MURAL WILL BE CREATED AND PLACED ON 20 HART BUSES TO INCLUDE THE NATIONAL HUMAN TRAFFICKING PHONE NUMBER 1-888-373-7888. FIVE OF THE BUS TYPOGRAPHICAL MURALS WILL BE DISPLAYED IN SPANISH TO REACH THE HISPANIC COMMUNITY. IN ADDITION HART WILL DISPLAY THE PUBLIC SERVICE CAMPAIGN INSIDE 100 BUSES HART TRANSFER CENTERS AND DRIVERS BREAK ROOMS. POSTCARDS WILL BE CREATED TO USE FOR PUBLIC OUTREACH EVENT.THE TARGETED POPULATION OF THE HUMAN AWARENESS CAMPAIGN WILL PRIMARILY BE VICTIMS OF HUMAN TRAFFICKING HART BUS OPERATIONS TRANSIT USERS RESIDENTS AND VISITORS IN THE WESTSHORE AND DOWNTOWN TAMPA. THE OBJECTIVES OF THE TRANSIT COOPERATIVE RESEARCH PROGRAM AS DESCRIBED IN THE FIRST GRANTAPPLICATION TO FTA ARE AS FOLLOWS: TO IDENTIFY TRANSIT PROBLEMS IN NEED OF RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT (RD) INVESTIGATION ANDTO ESTABLISH A PRIORITY RANKING AMONG THEM; TO PROVIDE AN OPPORTUNITY FOR TRANSIT OPERATORS LOCAL GOVERNMENT OFFICIALS AND MANY OTHERCONSTITUENCIES INCLUDING CONSTRUCTION ORGANIZATIONS FINANCIERS REAL ESTATE DEVELOPERS ANDCOMMUNITY REPRESENTATIVES TO IDENTIFY PROBLEMS AND PARTICIPATE IN DEVELOPING APPROPRIATESOLUTIONS; TO IMPROVE COMMUNICATIONS TECHNICAL INFORMATION TRANSFER AND EXCHANGE; AND TO PROVIDE A MEANS OF ADDRESSING A VARIETY OF NEAR-TERM TRANSIT PROBLEMS IN COOPERATIONAND IN COORDINATION WITH THE FEDERAL PROGRAM ON TRANSIT RESEARCH.FEDERAL ROLE:FTA PROVIDES MONITORING AND DIRECTION TO THE TCRP BY (1) PROVIDING GUIDANCE; (2) SERVING AS ANOFFICIAL VOTING MEMBER OF THE TOPS COMMISSION; (3) PROVIDING THE PRINCIPLES OF THE USDOTSTRATEGIC PLAN AS REFLECTED IN FTAS MOST RECENT ANNUAL MODAL RESEARCH PLAN EACH YEAR FORINCORPORATION INTO THE TCRP SOLICITATION FOR RESEARCH PROBLEM STATEMENTS; (4) REVIEWING ALLPROPOSED TCRP RESEARCH TO AVOID DUPLICATION OF EFFORT AND TO REINFORCE ANY RELATED ACTIVITIES; (5)PARTICIPATING IN ANY DECISION TO RE-DIRECT PROJECT ACTIVITIES; (6) APPOINTING A FTA LIAISON TO EACHTECHNICAL PANEL TO GUIDE IMPLEMENTATION OF TCRP PROJECTS TO ENSURE COORDINATION WITH OTHER FTARESEARCH; (7) PROVIDING PROBLEM STATEMENTS FOR CONSIDERATION BY THE TOPS COMMISSION INESTABLISHING THE ANNUAL AGENDA OF TCRP PROJECTS; (8) ATTENDING REVIEW MEETINGS; AND (9) ENSURINGTHAT ISSUES AND CONCERNS ARE RESOLVED AS THEY ARISE DURING IMPLEMENTATION OF THE TCRP PROJECTAGENDA. FTA PARTICIPATES IN THE PROJECT PANEL SELECTION PROCESS TO MAINTAIN DIVERSITY AND TO ENSURETHAT THE DEFINED PROJECT WORK STATEMENT IS NOT EXPANDED TO THE POINT THAT IT DOES NOT COINCIDE WITHTHE ORIGINAL PROBLEM STATEMENT APPROVED BY THE TOPS COMMISSION. FTA WORKS CLOSELY WITH TRBAND THE AMERICAN PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION ASSOCIATION (APTA) TO ENSURE DISSEMINATION DISTRIBUTIONMARKETING AND ADVERTISING OF TCRP STUDIES AND DEMONSTRATIONS WITH AN EMPHASIS ON THE TIMELYDEPLOYMENT AND MAINSTREAMING OF PRODUCTS AND PRACTICES RESULTING FROM THE TCRP.FTA RESERVES THE RIGHT TO RE-DIRECT PROJECT ACTIVITIES AND FUNDING FOR THE TRANSITCOOPERATIVE RESEARCH PROGRAM FY 2022 31TH YEAR SUPPORTED UNDER THIS AWARD ANDRELATED ACTIVITIES.RECIPIENT ROLE:THE NATIONAL ACADEMY OF SCIENCES ENGINEERING AND MEDICINES (NASEM) TRANSPORTATIONRESEARCH BOARD WILL MANAGE THE PROJECT AS OUTLINED IN THE APPLICATION INCLUDING ORGANIZING ANDMANAGING THE ANNUAL SOLICITATION OF PROBLEM STATEMENTS AND THEIR PREPARATION FOR CONSIDERATION BYTHE TOPS COMMISSION. TRB WILL CONVENE PROJECT PANEL MEETINGS APPOINT EXPERT TECHNICALPANELISTS TO DEFINE THE PROJECT WORK STATEMENT AND GUIDE THE RESEARCH; DEVELOP AND DISTRIBUTE AREQUEST FOR PROPOSALS; AND THEN PROCESS AND EVALUATE PROPOSALS TO SELECT THE BEST QUALIFIED RESEARCHAGENCY TO PERFORM THE WORK. ADDITIONALLY TRB WILL CONDUCT AND FOLLOW-UP ON DECISIONS RESULTINGFROM MEETINGS OF THE TOPS COMMISSION; ADMINISTER THE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT AND THIRD-PARTYCONTRACTS; PROVIDE QUARTERLY PROGRESS REPORTS FINANCIAL REPORTS AND FINAL CLOSE-OUT REPORTING TOFTA; AND DISSEMINATE THE RESULTS OF TCRP PROJECTS WIDELY THROUGH ON-LINE REPORTS THE TCRPWEBSITE WEBINARS SOCIAL MEDIA AND OTHER DISSEMINATION MECHANISMS.

THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO SUPPORT THE EFFORTS OF THE TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH BOARD (TRB) OF THE NATIONAL ACADEMY OF SCIENCES (NAS) IN MANAGING THE TRANSIT COOPERATIVE RESEARCH PROGRAM (TCRP) FOR FISCAL YEAR 2021. FTA PARTICIPATES IN THE PROJECT PANEL SELECTION PROCESS TO MAINTAIN DIVERSITY AND TO ENSURE THAT THE DEFINED PROJECT WORK STATEMENT IS NOT EXPANDED TO THE POINT THAT IT DOES NOT COINCIDE WITH THE ORIGINAL PROBLEM STATEMENT APPROVED BY THE TOPS COMMISSION. FTA WORKS CLOSELY WITH TRB AND APTA TO ENSURE DISSEMINATION DISTRIBUTION MARKETING AND ADVERTISING OF TCRP STUDIES AND DEMONSTRATIONS WITH AN EMPHASIS ON THE TIMELY DEPLOYMENT AND MAINSTREAMING OF PRODUCTS AND PRACTICES RESULTING FROM THE TCRP. FTA RESERVES THE RIGHT TO RE-DIRECT PROJECT ACTIVITIES AND FUNDING FOR THE TRANSIT COOPERATIVE RESEARCH PROGRAM FY 2021 30TH YEAR SUPPORTED UNDER THIS AWARD AND RELATED ACTIVITIES.RECIPIENT ROLE: THE NATIONAL ACADEMY OF SCIENCES ENGINEERING AND MEDICINES (NASEM) TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH BOARD (TRB) WILL MANAGE THE PROJECT AS OUTLINED IN THE APPLICATION INCLUDING ORGANIZING AND MANAGING THE ANNUAL SOLICITATION OF PROBLEM STATEMENTS AND THEIR PREPARATION FOR CONSIDERATION BY THE TOPS COMMISSION. WITH THE MIDDLEWARE SOFTWARE SUCCESSFULLY DEMONSTRATED IN THE SELECTED CORRIDOR THERE WOULD BE THE POTENTIAL FOR EXPANSION ACROSS THE SAN FRANCISCO BAY AREA REGION THROUGH GRADUAL INTEGRATION OF ADDITIONAL PARATRANSIT SERVICES. OPERATIONAL EFFICIENCIES GAINED FROM THE PROPOSED SYSTEM WILL ULTIMATELY ALLOW FOR BETTER PARATRANSIT CUSTOMER SERVICE.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: PARATRANSIT SERVICE PROVIDERS ALONG SAN FRANCISCO EAST BAY CORRIDOR(S) SERVING EQUITY PRIORITY COMMUNITIES WILL BE MTCS PARTNERS IN THIS PROJECT. THE DEMONSTRATION OF THE SYSTEM WILL BE ACHIEVED THROUGH COLLABORATIVE EFFORTS WITH THESE AGENCIES. OTHER PARATRANSIT PROVIDERS IN THE REGION WILL ALSO BE INFORMED ABOUT THE PROJECT PROGRESS.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE TRAVEL REWARD RESEARCH PILOT PROJECT WILL SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THE FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION (FTA) AND THE US DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION ACCELERATING INNOVATIVE MOBILITY (AIM) INITIATIVE BY DEVELOPING A RESEARCH PILOT TO IDENTIFY THE MOST COST-EFFECTIVE INCENTIVE TO SHIFT A SINGLE-OCCUPANCY VEHICLE (SOV) TRIP TO TRANSIT OR ANOTHER NON-SOV MODE (SHARED RIDE-HAIL CARPOOL VANPOOL WALK BIKE AND TELECOMMUTE) AND UNDERSTAND THE BEST WAY TO STRUCTURE DELIVER AND TIME INCENTIVES TO GET THE BEST RETURN ON INVESTMENT (ROI).; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: *THE PILOT WILL SUPPORT FARE INTEGRATION BETWEEN METROS TRANSIT ACCESS PASS (TAP) PROGRAM AND WITH PRIVATE MOBILITY PROVIDERS. * DEPLOY PILOTS THAT LEVERAGE BEHAVIORAL ECONOMICS APPLIED RESEARCH AND PRIVATE SECTOR TECHNOLOGY MOBILITY PARTNERS TO IDENTIFY AND TEST THE MOST EFFECTIVE INCENTIVES TO PERSUADE TRAVELERS TO SKIP DRIVING ALONE AND INSTEAD CHOOSE TRANSIT RIDESHARING WALKING BICYCLING OR TELECOMMUTING. *DEPLOYMENT OF INTERVENTION AND INCENTIVE PILOTS THAT LEVERAGE AN UNDERSTANDING OF THESE IRRATIONALITIES AS WELL OTHER BEHAVIORAL PRINCIPLES TO DEVELOP AND TEST FINANCIAL OR PROGRAMMATIC INCENTIVES THAT WILL WORK WITH TO TEST THE CONSTRAINTS OF HUMAN BIASES AND IRRATIONALITIES INCLUDING THE FOLLOWING: A. PURPOSE OF THE AWARD/ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: ROCK REGION METRO (METRO) WILL WORK WITH ITS PARTNERS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES COMPANY (ESC) AND UNIVERSITY OF ARKANSAS FOR MEDICAL SCIENCES (UAMS) TO RESEARCH TEST AND DEMONSTRATE UV LIGHTS ARE EFFECTIVE IN DISINFECTING COVID-19. THE TASKS OF THIS PROJECT FOR THE FTA WILL BE LED BY METRO. ESC WILL ACT AS THE RESEARCH LEAD AND WORK WITH METRO. UAMS WILL ACT AS THE INDEPENDENT EVALUATOR. IN PHASE A ESC WILL COLLECT SURFACE SAMPLES AND TEST THOSE SAMPLES TO ASSESS THE EFFICACY OF UV LIGHTS IN DISINFECTING TRANSIT BUSES. IN PHASE B ESC WILL PROVIDE A WRITTEN REPORT PROVING THE EFFICACY OF UV LIGHT USE FOR DISINFECTING TRANSIT BUSES. THIS REPORT WILL PROVIDE THE TRANSIT BUS INDUSTRY WITH SCIENTIFIC RESULTS ON THE EFFICACY OF USING UV LIGHTS TO DISINFECT TRANSIT BUSES. IF PROVEN EFFECTIVE METRO WILL PROVIDE EXPECTED COST SAVINGS OF USING UV LIGHTS TO DISINFECT BUSES COMPARED TO FOGGING BUSES WITH A CHEMICAL DISINFECTANT.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES/EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS PROJECT WITH BENEFIT ALL USERS OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION. THIS PROJECT WILL PROVE THE EFFICACY OF USING UV LIGHT TO DISINFECT TRANSIT VEHICLES. SUBSTANTIAL COST SAVINGS IN DISINFECTING COSTS COULD BE REALIZED IF THE LIGHT APPLICATION DEACTIVATES COVID-19.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: FTAS LONO-CAP PROGRAM IS STATUTORILY REFERENCED IN SECTION 49 U.S.C. 5312(H). THE PROGRAM WILL PROVID AN ANNUAL FUNDING FOR FY21-26 TO AUBURN UNIVERSITY FOR CAPITAL INVESTMENT DIRECTED RESEARCH AND TESTING ASSESSMENT AND CERTIFICATION OF LOW AND NO EMISSION COMPONENTS FOR USE ON GREEN PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION BUSES SOLD IN THE UNITED STATES. THE TOTAL ANTICIPATED FUNDING IS $14584986 (H.R.3684) AND WILL BE AWARDED AS FOLLOWS:FY21: $1500000 (AVAILABLE FOR AWARD BUT YET TO BE RECEIVED) FY22: $2500000FY23: $2552227FY24: $2618869FY25: $2672969FY26: $2740921; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: 1.DIRECTED RESEARCH SUPPORT: THE PROJECT PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATORS (PIS) WILL WORK WITH THE AUBURNS COLLEGE OF ENGINEERING (COE) DEANS OFFICE TO SOLICIT RESEARCH PROPOSALS WITHIN AUBURN UNIVERSITY. THESE PROPOSALS WILL ADDRESS AREAS OF TECHNOLOGICAL NEED FOR TRANSIT AUTHORITIES AND BUS MANUFACTURERS. THE TARGETED TECHNOLOGICAL NEEDS OF THE LONO TRANSIT VEHICLE COMMUNITY INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO PROJECTS THAT: (I) ENHANCE OR ENABLE BUS CABIN HEATING VENTILATION AND AIR CONDITIONING SYSTEMS IN ELECTRIFIED BUSES (II) ADDRESS BATTERY AGING CHARGING/DISCHARGING AND THE INTERPLAY OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS ON BATTERIES (III) DEVELOP/VALIDATE BUS DRIVER ASSISTANCE AND AUTOMATION SYSTEMS (IV) ELUCIDATE AND MITIGATE CYBERSECURITY ISSUES AND (V) PROMOTE HEALTH AND WELLNESS OF BUS OPERATORS AND OCCUPANTS. FURTHER INPUT FROM TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURES (TVM) TRANSIT AGENCIES AND ACADEMIC PARTNERS A GROUP THAT MEETS COLLECTIVELY IN SUPPORT OF TRANSIT VEHICLE AND INNOVATION DEPLOYMENT CENTERS (THE TVIDC ADVISORY PANEL) WILL BE USED TO GUIDE AND SELECT DIRECTED RESEARCH TOPICS WHEN MAKING THE CALL FOR PROPOSALS.2. CAPITAL IMPROVEMENTS: PROJECT FUNDS WILL BE SET ASIDE FOR CAPITAL EQUIPMENT AND FACILITIES UPGRADES THAT WILL DIRECTLY BENEFIT LONO CAP. BASED ON INPUT RECEIVED FROM THE TVIDC ADVISORY PANEL AND CONVERSATIONS WITH FTA THE MAJOR HURDLE BEING FACED BY TVMS AND TRANSIT AGENCIES IN ADOPTING BATTERY ELECTRIC BUSES (BEB) ARE CHALLENGES THE ENVIRONMENT TRANSIT ROUTES AND REQUIRED CABIN TEMPERATURE CREATE WHEN ATTEMPTING TO DETERMINE VEHICLE RANGE AND BATTERY AGING BEHAVIOR. THE TVIDC PANEL IDENTIFIED THE NEED TO HAVE A MULTI-AXLE DYNAMOMETER HOUSED IN AN ENVIRONMENTAL CHAMBER SUITABLE TO ACCOMMODATE A FULL SIZE BEB. AUBURN IS PROPOSING TO USE A PORTION OF THE CURRENT 5312 FUNDS THE CURRENT 5318 FUNDS AND THE ANTICIPATED 5312 FUNDS TO CONSTRUCT A DYNAMOMETER WITHIN AN ENVIRONMENTAL CHAMBER THAT MEETS THE NEEDS IDENTIFIED BY THE TVIDC. IN ADDITION TO THIS MAJOR OUTLAY DIRECTED RESEARCH PROJECTS WILL BE ALLOWED TO PROPOSE EQUIPMENT PURCHASES SUITING THE NEEDS OF THEIR PROJECT GOALS.3.LONO COMPONENT TESTING AUBURN UNIVERSITY WILL CONTINUE TO TEST AND ASSESS COMPONENTS THAT ARE PART OF LOW AND NO EMISSION BUSES. THESE COMPONENTS MAY INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO:CYBER VULNERABILITY ASSESSMENT AND PENETRATION TESTSELECTRIFIED AXLE AND WHEEL HUB MOTORSBATTERIES AND POWER DISTRIBUTION SYSTEMSPOWERTRAIN ASSESSMENTSHVACAUTOMATION AND DRIVER ASSIST SYSTEMSVEHICLE COMMUNICATION SYSTEMS ; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: REDUCE EMISSIONS FROM BATTERIES INCREASED BATTERY RANGE IN VARYING ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS AND INCREASE THE CYBER SECURITY TO IMPROVE COMPLIANCE FOR METRO AREAS ACROSS THE COUNTRY.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURERS TRANSIT AGENCIES END USER OF TRANSIT; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NO SUBAWARDS PLANNED

THE BRATS ON DEMAND PROJECT WILL SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THE FTA AND THE USDOTS MOBILITY INNOVATION INITIATIVE BY CONVERTING AN EXISTING RURAL DEMAND RESPONSE SERVICE INTO A FULLY FLEXIBLE INTEGRATED ON DEMAND SOLUTION TO PROVIDE TRANSIT ACCESS FOR ALL RESIDENTS INCLUDING SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH LIMITED MOBILITY AND LOWER INCOME COMMUNITIES WHILE REDUCING OPERATIONAL EXPENDITURES THROUGH INCREASED SERVICE EFFICIENCY AND CREATING A MORE RELIABLE SERVICE WITH SHORTER WAIT TIMES AND LONGER SERVICE HOURS.FTA AND THE USDOTS MOBILITY INNOVATION PROGRAM PROVIDES FEDERAL RESEARCH FUNDS TO PROJECT TEAMS TO DEMONSTRATE INNOVATIVE EFFECTIVE APPROACHES PRACTICES AND TECHNOLOGIES THAT ENHANCE EFFECTIVENESS INCREASE EFFICIENCY EXPAND QUALITY PROMOTE SAFETY AND ULTIMATELY IMPROVE THE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION RIDERS EXPERIENCE. THE GOAL OF THE BRATS ON DEMAND PROJECT IS TO 1) PROVIDE A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF HOW TRANSIT SYSTEMS THAT SERVE RURAL COMMUNITIES CAN SUCCESSFULLY CONNECT AND SERVE THOSE COMMUNITIES WITH A MOBILITY ON DEMAND SERVICE MODEL AND B) TO DEMONSTRATE THAT DEPLOYMENT IN BALDWIN COUNTYS SERVICE AREA. THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL PROVIDE FULLY ON-DEMAND SERVICE FOR ANY TRIPS STARTING AND ENDING WITHIN ONE OF THE FOUR HIGHER-DENSITY ZONES IN BALDWIN COUNTY. THIS WILL ALLOW THESE RESIDENTS TO BOOK RIDES AT ANY TIME ALLOWING FOR ERRANDS TRAVEL TO EDUCATION JOBS HEALTHCARE AND MORE. BALDWIN COUNTY ALSO EXPERIENCES REGULAR TRAVEL BETWEEN EACH OF THESE MAJOR ZONES. THESE TRIPS MANY OF WHICH RIDERS TAKE ON A DAILY BASIS TO COMMUTE TAKE UP TO AN HOUR OR MORE EACH WAY. THE AIM IS FOR RIDERS TO BE ABLE TO BOOK TRIPS DIRECTLY FROM THEIR ORIGIN TO THEIR DESTINATION ACROSS ZONES BY PRE-BOOKING TRIPS AT LEAST THREE HOURS IN ADVANCE. BY PRE-BOOKING THESE TRIPS THE SOFTWARE ALGORITHMS WILL BE ABLE TO BETTER AGGREGATE PASSENGERS TRAVELING IN SIMILAR DIRECTIONS ENSURING THE MOST EFFICIENT AND FINANCIALLY SUSTAINABLE SERVICE POSSIBLE. WE BELIEVE THIS APPROACH WILL BE IDEAL FOR RURAL AREAS AS IT MAXIMIZES THE NUMBER OF RIDES PER VEHICLE. THE BRATS ON DEMAND PROJECT WILL ACCOMPLISH THESE GOALS THROUGH A PARTNERSHIP WITH VIA TRANSPORTATION AN INDUSTRY LEADER IN MOBILITY ON DEMAND RIDESHARING TECHNOLOGY. BALDWIN COUNTY WILL PROVIDE THE VEHICLES AND SERVICES WHILE VIA WILL PROVIDE THE TECHNOLOGY AND SOFTWARE DEVELOPMENT EXPERTISE TO POWER THE RURAL MOD SYSTEM. VIAS MOBILITY EXPERTS HAVE GUIDED PUBLIC AND PRIVATE PARTNERS AROUND THE WORLD THROUGH THE COMPLEX EXERCISE OF PLANNING AN MOD DEPLOYMENT. THROUGH THESE SUCCESSFUL EXPERIENCES VIA HAS DEVELOPED AND REFINED A FIVE-STEP PROCESS THAT SHAPES PARTNER GOALS INTO A CONCRETE PLAN THAT BALANCES SERVICE COVERAGE COSTS AND RIDER EXPERIENCE. VIAS ITERATIVE FEEDBACK-BASED APPROACH ENSURES THAT PARTNERS EXPLORE ALL ON-DEMAND SERVICE OPTIONS AND UNDERSTAND HOW TO DESIGN A SERVICE THAT EXPANDS ACCESS TO MOBILITY IN TARGET COMMUNITIES INCREASES TRANSIT RIDERSHIP AND PROMOTES ENVIRONMENTAL SUSTAINABILITY. VIAS EXPERTS HAVE THOUGHT THROUGH SERVICE PLANNING CHALLENGES IN VIRTUALLY EVERY KIND OF ENVIRONMENT: BIG CITIES SMALL TOWNS IN RURAL AREAS AND CAR-ORIENTED SUBURBS. FOR ANY NEW ON-DEMAND TRANSIT SERVICE VIAS PLANNERS FOLLOW A WELL-DEVELOPED METHODOLOGY FOR ASSESSING CONTEXT-SPECIFIC OPPORTUNITIES AND CHALLENGES. IN SUPPORT OF THIS PROCESS VIA HAS DEVELOPED SOPHISTICATED TOOLS THAT ALLOW THEM TO EXPLORE MANY PERMUTATIONS OF SERVICE DESIGN AND THE TRADE-OFFS BETWEEN EFFICIENCY AND RIDER EXPERIENCE IN A GIVEN GEOGRAPHY. VIA WILL LEVERAGE ITS EXPERTISE TO DEVELOP DEPLOY AND TEST PRE-BOOKING TECHNOLOGY THAT WILL PROVIDE A CRITICAL LINK FOR ON-DEMAND DEPLOYMENTS IN RURAL AREAS.THE BRATS ON DEMAND PROJECTS INTENDED IMPACTS ARE: 1) VALIDATE THE FEASIBILITY OF RURAL MOD BUSINESS MODELS AND DOCUMENT BEST PRACTICES EMERGING FROM THE DEMONSTRATION. AT THE END OF THIS PROCESS VIA AND BALDWIN COUNTY WILL DEVELOP A DETAILED AND ACTIONABLE LAUNCH PLAN INCLUDING SPECIFIC STEPS FOR: 1) SYSTEM LOCALIZATION 2) MOBILE APPLICATION AND FEATURE CONFIGURATION 3) DRIVER TRAINING 4) SUPPORT TEAM TRAINING 4) SERVICE MARKETING AND BRANDING.2) MEASURE THE IMPACT OF MOD ON RURAL COMMUNITIES. BALDWIN COUNTY WILL WORK WITH VIA TO ENSURE A FULL SUITE OF PROJECT DATA IS AVAILABLE TO TRACK EVALUATE AND IMPROVE EACH ELEMENT OF THE DEPLOYMENT. THE DATA GATHERED WILL BE ANALYZED TO UNDERSTAND AT A GRANULAR LEVEL HOW THIS SERVICE CONTRIBUTES TO THE OVERALL QUALITY OF LIFE FOR THE COUNTYS RESIDENTS ENSURING THAT PROVIDED RIDES DELIVER EVERY ELEMENT OF A COMPLETE TRIP. THIS INFORMATION WILL BE USED TO ADVANCE THE TRANSIT INDUSTRYS ADOPTION OF MOD ESPECIALLY IN RURAL AREAS AND FOR INDIVIDUALS WITH LIMITED PERSONAL MOBILITY.3) INCREASED ACCESS FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH LIMITED PERSONAL MOBILITY. WITH NEW RELIABLE TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH LIMITED PERSONAL MOBILITY WILL BE ABLE TO LIVE LONGER HEALTHIER AND HAPPIER LIVES IN BALDWIN COUNTY. THROUGH A USER-FRIENDLY ON-DEMAND AND FULLY ACCESSIBLE SERVICE THAT COMES TO THEM WHEN THEY WANT IT BRATS ON DEMAND WILL PROVIDE THESE RIDERS WITH AN ENTIRELY NEW LEVEL OF ACCESS TO JOBS HEALTHCARE PLACES OF WORSHIP FRIENDS AND FAMILY AND ALL OTHER COMMUNITY RESOURCES. FURTHER THIS INCREASED MOBILITY WILL CONTRIBUTE TO AGING IN PLACE ALLOWING SENIORS TO LIVE AT HOME FOR LONGER EVEN IF THEY ARE UNABLE TO DRIVE. 4) INCREASED ECONOMIC ACTIVITY AND COMPETITIVENESS. THESE BENEFITS WILL GO BEYOND SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH LIMITED MOBILITY ALONE. WE ENVISION THAT THIS INCREASE IN MOBILITY FOR ALL RIDERS WILL STIMULATE ECONOMIC ACTIVITY WITH MORE COMMUNITY MEMBERS ABLE TO GO OUT TO DINNER SEE A MOVIE OR PARTICIPATE IN OTHER RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES WITHOUT A CAR. THIS INCREASED ACCESS TO DOWNTOWN AND OTHER REGIONAL AMENITIES WILL BOOST LOCAL BUSINESS HELPING BALDWIN COUNTY BECOME A MORE ECONOMICALLY COMPETITIVE REGION. IN PARALLEL TO THESE ECONOMIC OUTCOMES THE PROJECT HAS THE POTENTIAL TO PRODUCE OUTCOMES SUCH AS IMPROVED HEALTH DUE TO RESIDENTS BEING ABLE TO ACCESS APPOINTMENTS ON TIME EDUCATIONAL ATTAINMENT DUE TO RESIDENTS BEING ABLE TO MORE EASILY REACH SCHOOL AND JOB PERFORMANCE DUE TO THE INCREASE IN RELIABLE CAR-FREE COMMUTING.5) REDUCED OPERATIONAL COSTS. THE PROPOSED ON-DEMAND MODEL WILL BE A FLEXIBLE AND EFFICIENT TRANSIT SYSTEM THAT ALLOWS PARTNERS TO SAVE ON OPERATIONAL EXPENDITURES BY DEPLOYING A RIGHT-SIZED FLEET OF RIGHT-SIZED VEHICLES ACCORDING TO GRANULAR DEMAND DATA. PROJECT START DATE: WILL BE THE SAME AS THE DATE OF THE PROJECTS EXECUTION IN TRAMSPROJECT END DATE: DECEMBER 7 2021 (DEMONSTRATION TO CONCLUDE SEPTEMBER 7 2021 + THREE MONTHS OF FLOAT).THE PROJECT INCLUDES FUNDS FOR RESEARCH AND/OR DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES. FEDERAL ROLE: THE FTA WILL ACTIVELY PARTICIPATE IN THE PROJECT ACTIVITIES BY DIRECTING ACTIVITIES ATTENDING REVIEW MEETINGS COMMENTING ON TECHNICAL REPORTS AND MAINTAINING FREQUENT CONTACT WITH THE LOCAL PROJECT MANAGER. FTA RESERVES THE RIGHT TO RE-DIRECT PROJECT ACTIVITIES AND FUNDING FOR THE PROJECT SUPPORTED UNDER THIS AWARD AND THEIR RELATED ACTIVITIES. RECIPIENT ROLE: THE BALDWIN COUNTY COMMISSION ALONG WITH ITS PROJECT PARTNERS WILL MANAGE THE PROJECT AS OUTLINED IN THE ATTACHED STATEMENT OF WORK INCLUDING PREPARING TECHNICAL STATUS AND FINANCIAL REPORTS AND SUBMITTING DELIVERABLES. SPECIAL CONDITIONSTHE PROJECT WILL INCLUDE A PUBLIC PARTICIPATION MECHANISM. IF FIXED ROUTE SERVICE IS PROVIDED (INCLUDING ACTUAL OR VIRTUAL FLAG-STOP OPERATIONS) COMPLEMENTARY PARATRANSIT WILL BE PROVIDED ACCORDING TO 49 CFR PART 37. SUBPART F AND APPENDIX D. FOR DEMAND-RESPONSIVE SERVICE EQUIVALENT SERVICE WILL BE PROVIDED FROM THE OUTSET FOR PERSONS WITH AND WITHOUT DISABILITIES INCLUDING WHEELCHAIR USERS ACCORDING TO THE CRITERIA ESTABLISHED UNDER 49 CFR 37.77. WHEELCHAIR ACCESSIBLE VEHICLES WILL MEET THE REQUIREMENTS OF 49 CFR PART 38. AN ACCESSIBILITY / EQUITY PLAN WILL ENSURE ACCESSIBLE TECHNOLOGY AND ACCESS FOR THE UNBANKED/UNDERBANKED AND PERSONS WITHOUT SMART PHONES. LOCAL SHARETHE LOCAL SHARE OF THIS AWARD MAY BE DEFERRED AS NECESSARY CONSISTENT WITH THE PROJECT MILESTONE SCHEDULE. THE RECIPIENT WILL BE REIMBURSED FOR ACTUAL COSTS AS DETAILED IN THE PROJECT MILESTONE SCHEDULE AND PROJECT BUDGET. THE RECIPIENT AGREES THAT IT WILL MAINTAIN ADEQUATE COST RECORDS TO SUPPORT ANY PAYMENT REQUEST AND THAT THE PAYMENT REQUESTED WILL NOT EXCEED THE FEDERAL SHARE OF THE COSTS ACTUALLY INCURRED FOR THE MILESTONE. COMPLIANCE WITH OTHER FEDERAL PROVISIONSTHE RECIPIENT SHALL COMPLY WITH THE REQUIREMENTS OF FTA CIRCULAR 6100.1E RESEARCH TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND TRAINING PROGRAM: APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS AND PROGRAM MANAGEMENT GUIDELINES. THE RECIPIENT IS RESPONSIBLE FOR AWARDING OR MANAGING ANY THIRD-PARTY CONTRACTS OR PARTNERING ARRANGEMENTS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS PROJECT IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE REQUIREMENTS OF FTA CIRCULAR 4220.1F THIRD PARTY CONTRACTING REQUIREMENTS.
